bibl.author: Peter Doyle
bibl.title: Peter Doyle to Walt Whiman, 18 September [1868]
bibl.orgName: Papers of Walt Whitman (MSS 3829), Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Albert H. Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia

body.p: I could not resist the inclination to write to you this morning it seems more than a week since iI saw you there is hardly anything of interest transpired since you went away except occasionaly some one inquires for the Major, or the General or some familiar name which no doubt which you have heard so often Dear Walt I have examined that book (Pollards History) and iI am Veryvery much displeased with it iI find it is quite the opposite from what iI was led to believe iI thought it mentioned the movements of the different companyscompanies & Regiments iI am sorry that iI made such a mistake because the Book is of no interest to me

inclosedenclosed you will find somemthing from this mornings CronicleChronicle it seems the Washington Papers has you right for once iI am very impatient to hear from you to know that you are doing well Dave & all the rest of the Rail Road boys is well & sends their best respects mother had a very sick headache when iI left home this morning iI have to cut this short as iI write a part of it while the car is in motion
